page.title: 01DALWOOD VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Dalwood is situated in a sheltered valley in East Devon between the towns of Honiton and Axminster. It lies between two ridges of the Blackdown Hills. Through the valley runs the Corrie Brook, a tributary of the River Yarty, itself a tributary of the River Axe. The village population is around 500. The village is of considerable natural beauty and in 198? won a 'Best Kept Village' award.Local amenities include a Village Stores, Primary School, village Inn and Hall. Local buildings are of stone, cob and thatch. The village is surrounded by farm land. Dalwood means 'dale in a wood',though there are now less trees and hedges than fifty years ago. Dalwood was originally in Dorset.
